Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice with part of handle zone; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown with two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of feline or sphinx seated to right (part of rump and hind leg remaining); part of rising roundel as filling ornament; below at junction with handle zone, two dilute lines.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the seated creature, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.114.30.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0428) (phase 2)
